H0.text: Organs are different types of tissues organized into functional units.

H1.text: Tendons are different types of tissues organized into functional units.

H2.text: Arteries are different types of tissues organized into functional units called arteries.

H3.text: Veins are different types of tissues organized into functional units.

A4.text: In the hierarchy of life, an organ lies between tissue and an organ system. Tissues are formed from same type cells to act together in a function. Tissues of different types combine to form an organ which has a specific function.

A5.text: The intestinal wall for example is formed by epithelial tissue and smooth muscle tissue.
